intro: Monnina phytolaccifolia, commonly known as the redroot sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Polygalaceae family and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and hairy stems. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically oval-shaped with a hairy texture, and it thrives in well-drained sandy or gravelly soils. Monnina phytolaccifolia is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
